item.description: Shopping has always been a game. And now it’s being rigged against you.

item.title: ‘Hamnet’ Reimagines Shakespeare for the TikTok Generation
item.description: Our love of his plays have led to a centuries-long fascination with the writer. So why does each new fictional iteration get his life so wrong?

item.title: Goodbye, Price Tags. Hello Dynamic Pricing.
item.description: Shopping has always been a game. And now it’s being rigged against you.

item.title: What I Love When I Love America
item.description: My love of country this Thanksgiving season is not based on what this or that politician does, but on what America has always been.

item.title: Why We Need Fairy Tales in the Digital Age
item.description: The internet is a dangerous place. Folklore can teach us how to move through it.

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: Undocumented Immigrants Need Your Help
item.description: These organizations are squeezed between an expanding need for their services and an administration trying to starve them of resources.

item.title: Don’t Celebrate Franco. Bury HIm.
item.description: Fifty years after the death of the Spanish dictator, his legacy lives on.

item.title: Mamdani, His Mother and a Movie of Prescient Grace
item.description: The mayor-elect ran a hopeful campaign amid ugly insinuations about 9/11. When I recall where I was on that day, I have a very different association.

item.title: A Kitchen Cure for Depression
item.description: As long as I get myself to pay attention, there is too much going on in the kitchen world for me to spin off into anxious abstraction.

item.title: Goodbye, Price Tags. Hello, Dynamic Pricing.
item.description: Shopping has always been a game. And now it’s being rigged against you.

item.title: The Uniquely American Heartbreak of Yet Another Tragedy
item.description: The National Guard members shot in Washington are the latest victims of a political violence permeating our society.

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: The World’s Poorest People Need Your Help
item.description: With suffering everywhere, give directly to those most in need and help those around you.

item.title: Trump’s Greedy Thanksgiving
item.description: This year, it’s not about giving back; it’s about getting yours.

item.title: Can the Potluck Cure America’s Loneliness Crisis?
item.description: The number of Americans eating alone has increased by 53 percent since 2003.

item.title: What Hunger Looks Like in America
item.description: We spoke with dozens of people living with hunger in the United States. These are their stories.

item.title: A Pardoned Turkey, an Unpardonable Man
item.description: Many affluent Americans no longer believe in civic institutions or community groups.

item.title: ‘We Are Going to Have to Fight Three Wars’
item.description: How much will Trump ask Zelensky to pay for peace in Ukraine?

item.title: Extreme Measures for the Fentanyl Crisis
item.description: Readers respond to a guest essay about America’s fentanyl problem. Also: A dark echo at Penn.

item.title: Time to Let My Brother Kevin Do the Carving
item.description: My brother takes a slice out of Trump and Mamdani.

item.title: America, the Hungry
item.description: One in seven people in America lives with hunger. These are their stories.

item.title: 65 Is Not Old Anymore
item.description: Ken Stern on why Americans should stop classifying 65 as “old.”

item.title: America, the Hungry
item.description: One in seven people in America lives with hunger. These are their stories.

item.title: The Real Meaning of MAHA Is ‘You’re On Your Own’
item.description: The N.I.H. director has learned all the wrong lessons from Covid.

item.title: Larry Bushart Posted a Charlie Kirk Meme. He Went to Jail for 37 Days.
item.description: The best way to honor Charlie Kirk is not to criminalize speech.

item.title: A.I. Is Marketing Itself as the Anti-A.I.
item.description: Artificial intelligence is unpopular and uncool — so A.I. companies are making ads that don’t even bother to show their own products. Will it pay off?

item.title: The Loneliness of Using a Faith-Based Chatbot
item.description: Faith is not meant to be transactional or tailored to you.

item.title: Mark Kelly Is Being Investigated for Telling the Truth
item.description: Who wants to silence a senator? I’ll give you one guess.

item.title: Thanksgiving Is a Celebration of American Rebirth
item.description: An opportunity for families and friends and, by extension, communities, states, and the country itself to have a national reset.

item.title: A Simple Way to Avoid Holiday Family Drama
item.description: There’s good evidence that learning to live with your loved ones just as they are leads to more happiness for you.

item.title: What Your Signature Dish Says About You
item.description: Like your astrological sign, what you bring says a lot about who you are.

item.title: The High Stakes in the Ukraine Talks
item.description: Readers discuss the proposed deal to end the war between Ukraine and Russia. Also: Immigrant family separations; unplugging A.I.

item.title: Has Marjorie Taylor Greene Really Seen the Light?
item.description: This is a classic breakup drama.

item.title: The Justice Department Should Redact the Epstein Files
item.description: Releasing the documents wholesale could hinder prosecutions and inflict new trauma on victims.

item.title: 9,192,631,770 Hz
item.description: How do we measure time? Technically, by the oscillations of a cesium atom. This film tells a human story behind an element from the periodic table: cesium.

item.title: The Broken Circle
item.description: Farmers in Northwest China confront their drying landscape by planting trees as coal burns relentlessly nearby. This film tells a human story behind an element from the periodic table: carbon.

item.title: BAEA
item.description: A bald eagle is treated for lead poisoning, becoming a symbol of a toxic system that threatens us all. This film tells a human story behind an element from the periodic table: lead.

item.title: It’s Time to Build Nuclear Power Plants Again
item.description: California and eight other states have outdated restrictions on building nuclear power plants.

item.title: I Went to an Anti-Vaccine Conference. Medicine Is in Trouble.
item.description: A journey to the fringe of MAHA.

item.title: Trump Falls Short of His Populist Rhetoric
item.description: The Trump administration is using its antitrust powers mostly to protect Mr. Trump.

item.title: A.I. Dominates Our World. Why Don’t Democrats Have a Plan?
item.description: To stay relevant for 2028, the party needs to figure one out.

item.title: Donate This Holiday Season: The Middle East Needs Your Help
item.description: This holiday season, I am donating to nonprofits that help make community ecosystems and nature’s ecosystems more resilient.

item.description: The administration’s drug war rhetoric seems like a pretext. But a pretext for what?

item.title: Why Trump Won’t Face Prosecution When He Leaves Office in 2029
item.description: The president has a very big immunity umbrella.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg’s Profile in Courage
item.description: Readers express sorrow about her cancer and dismay at her cousin’s actions as health secretary. Also: Revenge prosecutions; Mark Kelly; donors to universities.

item.title: How Is QAnon Reacting to the Epstein Files?
item.description: It has a little something to do with Donald Trump.

item.title: James Carville: Out With Woke. In With Rage.
item.description: Democrats also have to shed the last vestiges of woke.

item.title: The Outrageous False Equivalences That Prop Up President Trump
item.description: Aren’t his apologists exhausted by their moral calisthenics?

item.title: Yes, We Must Talk About Epstein
item.description: Readers strongly object to David Brooks’s argument that we should focus on more important issues. Also: Firings at the National Endowment for the Humanities.

item.title: Cory Booker on What It Takes to Believe in America Again
item.description: “If America hasn’t broken your heart, you don’t love her enough,” the New Jersey senator argues.
